definition: a burst/a fit/a peal/a spell (period of time)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration
a while/a spell/a short time/a burst

sentences.english: A strong wind blows the beer can into the river.
sentences.chinese: 一陣強大的風把啤酒罐吹到了河裏面了。

sentences.english: For starters, it's being held in the gymnasium at Valley High School, a few miles from the Strip.
sentences.chinese: 訓練在山谷高中已經有一陣子，距離繁華區有幾英里。

sentences.english: His vision blurred and a wave of dizziness washed over him.
sentences.chinese: 他的視線模糊了，一陣頭暈目眩衝擊着他。

sentences.english: A burst of hand-clapping followed the end of the song.
sentences.chinese: 歌聲結束後是一陣熱烈的掌聲。

sentences.english: A sudden gust of wind from the open window puffed the candle out.
sentences.chinese: 從開着的窗戶吹來一陣急風，吹滅了蠟燭。

sentences.english: A burst of hand-clapping followed the ending of the story.
sentences.chinese: 在故事的結尾爆發了一陣陣掌聲。

sentences.english: With a scream of braking, the life of Yingzi flew up gently.
sentences.chinese: 隨着一陣拔尖的煞車聲，櫻子的一生輕輕地飛了起來。

sentences.english: He is down with a nasty bout of flu.
sentences.chinese: 他患了一陣子感冒，很難受。

sentences.english: The victim was hit by a hail of bullets.
sentences.chinese: 受害者被一陣彈雨擊中。

sentences.english: His voice was tense, a ripple of emotion flowing through it.
sentences.chinese: 他的聲音是時態，一陣流動過它的情緒漣波。

sentences.english: Live in Northern California once, but leave before it makes you soft.
sentences.chinese: 去北加州住一陣子，但在心神松懶前搬走。

sentences.english: Then he heard a clanking noise deep down below .
sentences.chinese: 接着他聽見地下深處傳來一陣叮噹聲。

sentences.english: She covered her mouth with her hand, another wave of chills flowing over her as her knees literally knocked together.
sentences.chinese: 她用手捂住嘴，又一陣惡寒讓她全身發抖，膝蓋打顫。

sentences.english: There was a laugh which he cut off brusquely with a gesture.
sentences.chinese: 人們發出一陣鬨笑，他做了個手勢，猛然制止了笑聲。

sentences.english: Tom was sitting near the fire when he heared a knock located on the door.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆正坐在火爐邊，這時他聽到一陣敲門聲。

definition: from time to time/now and then/occasionally/frequently
first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
to have guts/to have courage/to be brave
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
